categories: Category:Articles with an excess of redlinks

nodes.text: TIE Fighter Owners' Workshop Manual is a canon reference book written by Ryder Windham and illustrated by Chris Reiff and Chris Trevas. The book focuses on the TIE line of starships used by the Galactic Empire and First Order. The book was released on May 28, 2019.

This is a Haynes Manual based on the Sienar Fleet Systems TIE Fighter, the iconic space superiority fighter which has long been the mainstay of Imperial and First Order forces, customised variants of which were piloted by Sith Lord Darth Vader in the original Star Wars Trilogy, and Kylo Ren during the First Order's war with the Resistance.

Using brand-new cutaway illustrations, together with other art and photographs, this manual provides the most thorough technical description and operating guide available for the various TIE Fighter variants, making it essential reading for all Star Wars fans.
Fully authorised and approved by Lucasfilm.
Throughout the book, the TIE/ln space superiority starfighter is erroneously referred to as the "TIE/in space superiority starfighter." On page 67, "Pryce" is misspelled as "Price."

On page 36, the TIE/sa bomber's missile port is incorrectly labelled (and misspelled) as a "bombadier viewport," and its reactor housing is incorrectly given the "missile port" label.[source?] Similarly, on pages 64 and 69, the TIE/d "Defender" Multi-Role Starfighter and TIE/D Defender Elite's chin-mounted missile launchers are mistakenly identified as laser cannons. On page 79, the word "two" is written twice in a row at the end of the last paragraph. On page 82, the TIE/fo space superiority fighter is incorrectly referred to as a TIE/ln space superiority starfighter in the description of its dark-colored hull.
